fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
# Create a new custom field of type *User Picker*. Name this custom field, _R&D Reporter_.
# Add this custom field to the *Default Issue Screen*.
# Create a new issue and fill up the field with a user's name.
# Once the issue is created, go to the issue. The field's name would be rendered as _R&D Reporter_. See the screenshot below:
!Selection_002.png!

This problem only occurs in 4.4 as the problem is not reproducible in 4.3.4 and below.
!Selection_003.png!
fields.summary: Ampersand Does Not Render Appropriately in View Issue Screen
Allow Zoom In and Zoom Out For the View Workflow Feature

fields.description:
It appears that on some flavours of Linux, when the automated JIRA Linux installer is executed with root-level privileges, the 'jira' user account is not created.

Here's some more information from a customer's comment on [our relevant documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Installing+JIRA+on+Linux]:

{quote}
I found the bin/setup_user.sh script and ran it separately (output is below), which revealed that the script is using a useradd option that's not supported in my version of Linux, which is: SUSE Linux Enterprise Server 11 (x86_64); VERSION = 11; PATCHLEVEL = 1

\# /opt/atlassian/jira/bin/setup_user.sh -d /var/atlassian/application-data/jira -i /opt/atlassian/JIRA
useradd: invalid option -- 'K'
Try `useradd --help' or `useradd --usage' for more information.
chown: invalid user: `jira'
chown: invalid user: `jira'
chown: invalid user: `jira'
chown: invalid user: `jira'

This command will fix the script:
sed -ie 's~ -K UMASK=0077~~' /opt/atlassian/jira/bin/setup_user.sh
{quote}
fields.summary: On some flavours of Linux, when the automated JIRA Linux installer is executed with root-level privileges, the 'jira' user account is not created.

fields.description:
The Dashboard, Projects, Issues, and other menus don't work in IE9.

Drop-down arrows next to 'Dashboards', 'Projects', and 'Issues' do not work. Creates a Javascript error:
Webpage error details
User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 7.0; Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; Trident/5.0; SLCC2; .NET CLR 2.0.50727; .NET CLR 3.5.30729; .NET CLR 3.0.30729; .NET4.0C; .NET4.0E; InfoPath.3)
Timestamp: Sun, 25 Sep 2011 22:04:56 UTC
Message: Unable to get value of the property 'left': object is null or undefined
Line: 247
Char: 523
Code: 0
URI: http://jira.health.local/s/en_UK-bhbt0k/660/5/1/_/download/superbatch/js/batch.js

(*) Also occurs when clicking drop-down list for 'Component/s' when creating a new issue.
(*) Looks to be same error as the dot dialog problem [JRA-25568] but not confirmed
fields.summary: Menus don't work in IE9 in compatibility mode
tets

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25791].
  {panel}

I'm trying to connect JIRA 4.4.1 to a Sql Server 2008 database using Windows Authentication (it's a violation of my company's security policy to store passwords in files, so I must try to avoid using Sql accounts).

I attached the error I'm seeing. Although jTDS supports windows authentication, I think your parser is requiring the username and password to be specified.

I've attached my dbconfig.xml. Note that there is no username or password element. I've also tried just leaving the username and password element blank and got the same error.

Please add support for Windows Authentication and Sql Server.
fields.summary: Windows Authentication doesn't work on Sql Server

fields.description:
the alt text appears to have vanished on some of the images. I noticed this first on our local installation when it moved to 4.1.1, but I see that this is also true on 4.4.1. The previous issues/next issue arrows, for example, still have the title attribute set, but not the alt attribute set.

(For what it's worth, this is not a hypothetical accessibility problem; it is causing me accessibility problems right now.)
fields.summary: alt text has vanished on some images

fields.description:
JIRA 4.4.1, database configuration tool will automatically add 'sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB' parameter into the database URL of the dbconfig.xml file.

However in certain situation, such as user upgrade from JIRA 4.4 (copy dbconfig.xml to JIRA 4.4.1 Home). The below warning will shown even storage engine used is InnoDB:

{noformat}
****************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************
WARNING: JIRA is using the MyISAM engine from MySQL. This configuration can introduce performance problems. For more information please see https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-24124.
****************************************************************************************************************************************************************************************

{noformat}

To reproduce the problem:
# Setup database connection using database configuration tool
# Startup JIRA until all table created
# Check on database to make sure InnoDB is used
# Open dbconfig.xml and remove attribute 'sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB'
# Startup JIRA and error above will shown.
|

This message can be safely ignore if InnoDB has been used for storage engine.

Workaround:
* Add 'sessionVariables=storage_engine=InnoDB' to dbconfig.xml
fields.summary: JIRA might give false alarm on MySQL storage engine
Re-index : Increase thread number for large instance

fields.description: I just upgraded from 4.2.4_b591 to 4.4.1. The mail queue is no longer flushing. There are no errors in the logs. The queue just doesn't automatically flush. The com.atlassian.jira.service.services.mail.MailQueueService service is set to 1. Nothing happens. Please advise.
fields.summary: Mail queue is not flushing

fields.description:
This can be reproduce easily by:
# create two users with Fullname "Bjorn, Doe" and "Frank,Smith" as shown in screenshot Users.png
# in a project that has Notification Scheme configured, create an issue and assign it to any of the users created above. Eg: "Frank, Smith"
# reassign the issue to other user "Bjorn, Doe"
# check the notification. The Assignee Full Name are mixed like as per screenshot Notification.png

This behaviour is not reproducible without comma in the Full Name. 

This also reproducible in JIRA 5.1.1
fields.summary: Odd parsing of assignee change in notification

fields.description:
We have upgraded our test environement to jira 4.3.4. According to the documentation, it is possible to find issue that steped in a given status by someone:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA043/Advanced+Searching?clicked=jirahelp#AdvancedSearching-Status
Find issues that were resolved by Joe Smith:
status WAS "Resolved" BY jsmith

However, in my jql query, I cannot (donnot) see any 'BY' operator when I use the WAS operator on the status.

Is this operation really available? If yes, how can I use it?
fields.summary: Cannot search an issue that was in status by a peculiar user

fields.description:
The Road Map gadget does not display a selected project if the project has version(s) with no release date set.

This can be very difficult to conclude if 'All projects' is selected.
fields.summary: Road Map Gadget - blank if no version release date set for a project

fields.description:
State of problem:
# A user (Developer) was created in JIRA and assigned to a new group (Development).
# Development group is given the permission to *Assign Issues* and *Assignable User*.
!permission_scheme.png|thumbnail!
# Development group is also given the project Roles *Administrators*, *Developers* and *Users*.
!project_roles.png|thumbnail!
# Attempt to create an issue in JIRA. The user *Developer* is able to assign issues to another user.
!create_issue_in_JIRA.png|thumbnail!
# Go to GreenHopper's Agile page, and create a new card. Attempt to assign the issue to another user. This results in a failure since the group *Development* is not given the global permission *Browse Users*.
!create_issue_in_Agile_01.png|thumbnail!
# Go back to Administration, and assign the Development group to the *Browse Users* global permission.
** Before:
!browse_users_permission_01.png|thumbnail!
** After:
!browse_users_permission_02.png|thumbnail!
* Go back to Agile, and attempt to assign a user to a new card. This time, you can browse the list of users.
!create_issue_in_Agile_02.png|thumbnail!

Which begs the question: if a group is not given the permission to *Browse Users*, how is he able to assign issues to users in JIRA? Is this intentional?

We understand that GreenHopper doesn't allow this as it respects the *Browse Users* permission, but can the same be said of JIRA?

Attached is a screen-cast video of the entire replication process: http://dl.dropbox.com/u/3233473/jra25573_screencast.mpeg
fields.summary: Groups with no "Browse Users" Permission are Able to Select Assignees During Issue Creation

fields.description:
If an administrator changes the Issue Type Scheme for a project that they do not have Browse Permission to then if there are any issue types that do not exist in the scheme that they are moving to the issues will remain the same.
Steps to replicate:
# Create a JIRA Instance with fresh data and login as an administrator
# Create a new project with everything as default
# Create a new issue of the type 'New Feature'
# Create a new 'Issue Type Scheme' with only 'Bug' as an available issue type
# Remove the group 'jira-users' (the only group that should have browse permission for projects) from the current user.
# Change the issue type scheme for your project to the new one you have created. 

Expected outcome: You should be either denied permission, or run through the wizard so that you can convert the issue type to bug.

Actual outcome: Scheme changes over, but the issue you created earlier of type 'New Feature' is still that type despite the scheme not allowing it (you'll obviously need to add yourself to the jira-users group again to check the ticket out).
fields.summary: Changing issue type scheme with no 'Browse Project' permission leads to no issue type change
Single user with permission to Link Issues for a Project, is not allowed to Link Issues.
JIRA should know crowd's inactive-user-flag and not count against license

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25767].
  {panel}

Scenario:
1. Work is logged and a 'logged work' entry appears in the 'Activity' list e.g. 1 hour. There is no 'Worklog Id' displayed.
2. Subsequently the time logged on this activity is changed from 1 hour to 2 hours
3. The 'Activity' list now shows two entries. One for 1 hour (original entry) and a new one 'made changes' which shows the original time, the new time and a 'Worklog Id'.

Problem:
Without going to another screen, there is no way to relate the change (='made changes') of 1 hour to the earlier original (='logged work') entry of 1 hour. Only the original entry includes the text describing what action was taken.

Solution:
Inlcude the 'Worklog Id' in every entry on the Activity list. This is only a few characters but allows the viewer to easily follow the trail of changes back through the Activity list.
fields.summary: There is no worklog id included in the "logged work" entry under "activity"
Inconsistant field identifier for "Issue Type"
Bundle latest QE/QC plugin with JIRA 4.4.2

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25764].
  {panel}

Is there a reason JIRA does not utilize or document the use of the "-server" JVM input arguement? To get a better understanding of how this parameter is useful, please see the following excerpt from http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/technotes/guides/vm/index.html :

{quote}
On all platforms, the JDK comes with an implementation of the Java virtual machine called the Java HotSpot Server VM (server VM). The server VM is designed for maximum program execution speed. It can be invoked by using the -server command-line option when launching an application.

Excerpt from
The Java HotSpot Performance Engine Architecture
http://java.sun.com/products/hotspot/whitepaper.html

The JDK includes two flavors of the VM - a client-side offering, and a VM tuned for server applications. These two solutions share the Java HotSpot runtime environment code base, but use different compilers that are suited to the distinctly unique performance characteristics of clients and servers. These differences include the compilation inlining policy and heap defaults.

The JDK contains both of the these systems in the distribution, so developers can choose which system they want by specifying -client or -server.

Although the Server and the Client VMs are similar, the Server VM has been specially tuned to maximize peak operating speed. It is intended for executing long-running server applications, which need the fastest possible operating speed more than a fast start-up time or smaller runtime memory footprint.

The Client VM compiler serves as an upgrade for both the Classic VM and the just-in-time (JIT) compilers used by previous versions of the JDK. The Client VM offers improved run time performance for applications and applets. The Java HotSpot Client VM has been specially tuned to reduce application start-up time and memory footprint, making it particularly well suited for client environments. In general, the client system is better for GUIs.

The Client VM compiler does not try to execute many of the more complex optimizations performed by the compiler in the Server VM, but in exchange, it requires less time to analyze and compile a piece of code. This means the Client VM can start up faster and requires a smaller memory footprint.

The Server VM contains an advanced adaptive compiler that supports many of the same types of optimizations performed by optimizing C++ compilers, as well as some optimizations that cannot be done by traditional compilers, such as aggressive inlining across virtual method invocations. This is a competitive and performance advantage over static compilers. Adaptive optimization technology is very flexible in its approach, and typically outperforms even advanced static analysis and compilation techniques.
{quote}
fields.summary: Do we utilize the "-server" JVM option?

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25763].
  {panel}

It would be great if we can have another look into the modules used for processing the patterns for project keys.

The [documentation|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Configuring+Project+Keys] currently states that we should avoid using *"." and "-"*, but any one who is familiar with regular expressions expects to use them with minimal exception to the defining standard. 

A recent support case arose when a customer used:

* jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z]([-_.]?[A-Z0-9])*)

The workaround was:
{quote}
To "fix" the problem on my desktop, I had to use a very specific set of conditions:

# The pattern had to be encapsulated in a simple capture group (i.e. bounded with "(" and ")").
# All interior groups (parenthetic groups) had to be non-capturing (i.e. bounded with "(?:" and ")". As follows in my case:
** jira.projectkey.pattern = ([A-Z](?:[-_.]?[A-Z0-9])*)

That said, the fix is a work-around, not a true fix.

As you are aware, the pattern is processed using the

* java.util.regex.Pattern

and

* java.util.regex.Matcher

classes. The full specification of the pattern language can be found in the JavaDoc:
* http://download.oracle.com/javase/6/docs/api/java/util/regex/Pattern.html
{quote}
fields.summary: Improve on the Project Key modules

fields.description: I'd like to request to limit the assign button list to a specific group per issue transition.
fields.summary: Limit assign list per transition

fields.description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# Setup SSL connection as in http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Running+JIRA+over+SSL+or+HTTPS
# Make sure that the Base URL is correct (HTTPS) at General Configuration
# Create two projects 'Test1' and 'Test2'
# Create a new Issue Type Scheme 'Scheme1'
# Associate Issue Type Scheme 'Scheme1' to 'Test1' while 'Test2' use the Default Scheme
# Create an issue in 'Test1' and try to move it:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Moving+an+Issue
# There will be a popup error:
!secure_popup.png!
# If project 'Test2' is associated with Issue Type Scheme 'Scheme1', there won't be any error anymore.

Tested reproducible in JIRA 4.02 and 4.4 easily

Need to refresh the 'Move Issue' page a lot of time to reproduce the error in JIRA 4.3.4
fields.summary: HTTP/HTTPS security warning popups on IE 8 when moving issue between projects with different Issue Type Schemes
Wider and more friendly "Issue Search" screen

fields.description:
Here are the following steps on how to reproduce this bug: 1. Set up Application Link between JIRA 4.4 and Confluence 3.5 (Trusted Apps or OAuth authentication are fine) 2. Under one single project in JIRA (e.g: TEST project), try creating a few issues 3. Access to a Confluence page and edit that page 4. Try inserting JIRA Issues Macro by grabbing the XML URL from the JIRA issues: - http://10.60.1.174:8440/sr/jira.issueviews:searchrequest-xml/temp/SearchRequest.xml?jqlQuery=project+%3D+TEST&tempMax=1000 | 5. Set the Cache to Off 6. Click on 'Refresh' button 7. The JIRA Issues Macro got displayed successfully as per this screen shot: !JIRA_Issues_Macro_Success.jpg|thumbnail! 8. Then, go to JIRA 4.4 User Profile and change the Language to *any other Language pack other than English (United States or UK)* 9. Go back to the same Confluence page and try to insert JIRA Issues Macro by clicking on 'Refresh' button 10. You will be seeing the following error thrown inside JIRA Issues: bq. Unable to generate JSON output
class java.io.IOException !JIRA_Issues_Macro_Fail.jpg|thumbnail! (i) For Danish (Denmark), Dutch (Belgium), German (Germany), and German (Switzerland) language, it happens intermittently - sometimes success and sometimes fail Not only JIRA Issues Macro that is having this problem, even inserting a JIRA Macro is also having the same problem. For example: - {jira:project = TEST|server=Your Company JIRA|cache=off} I have tried the same behavior with JIRA 4.3.x against Confluence 3.5.x and this problem does not occur in JIRA 4.3.x. This means that this problem arises only from JIRA 4.4 onwards.
fields.summary: Language Pack none other than English does not display JIRA Macro and JIRA Issues Macro correctly

Kapil Gupta
INDIA

fields.description:
Prior to 4.4, setting a value for a custom field would set the value directly, now you need to specify the ID for that value in select custom fields. This breaks existing jelly scripts.

If we could change it so that existing script continue to work, but perhaps have an ID option as well as the value option that would be optimal.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25744].
  {panel}

Certain jpg files cause an exception to be raised which affects the rendering of the Attachment section while viewing an issue. Most jpgs do not cause this exception. Affected images do display in the "Attach Files" dialog during file attachment. Ideally JIRA could catch the exception and display a placeholder image as well as rendering the other attachments.

The root cause of the issue seems to be the java image processor, possibly during the creation of a thumbnail. The issue was present in java 5 but was masked. When we upgraded to JIRA 4.4 we also upgraded Java and this issue is now more visible due to bug fixes in Java. (http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=6791502)

The exception is "javax.imageio.IIOException: Invalid icc profile: bad sequence number" - I can provide the entire trace if that would help.

The only images I have contain protected information. I am working to have a generic image created which I will attach to this issue. The attached screenshot is an issue with 3 attachments but none show. If I delete the offending JPG the remain two attachments are displayed properly.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an issue with attachments
2. Attach a JPG that causes the javax.imageio.IIOException exception (I will provide)
3. View the issue - some or all attachments will not be displayed
4. Click "Manage Attachments" and delete the offending JPG
5. View the issue - attachments will be displayed properly
fields.summary: Attaching certain JPGs causes Attachments section of issue view to not render

*Steps to reproduce:*

# Go to the view issue page.
# Scroll down the page.
# Open a dropdown in the navbar, e.g. issues.
# Highlight the first item.

*Result:* The page is automatically scrolled upwards, even though the highlighted item was already fully in view. This does not occur on pages other than view issue, and is due to the presence of the stalker. {{jQuery.fn.scrollIntoView}} (scrollIntoView.js) is miscalculating the element's position when trying to account for the stalker.

fields.description:
When a field cannot be seen by the user JQL assumes that the field does not exist. A field cannot be seen by a user if it is not visible in any projects that the user can see. We don't follow the same behaviour in the WAS clause.

# Restore the attached data [^data.zip].
# Login as admin/admin. 
# Run {{reporter was "admin" and reporter = admin}}. You will get no results but the query is valid.
# Login as fred/fred. Fred can only see the "DOG" project which has the reporter, resolution and priority fields hidden.
# (DEFECT) Run {{reporter was "admin" and reporter = admin}}. You will get no results but the query is valid. You will get the error messages:
{noformat}
The value 'admin' does not exist for the field 'reporter'.
Field 'reporter' does not exist or you do not have permission to view it.
{noformat}

The first error is from the was 'reporter was admin'. It leaks that the field actually exists, though it does not leak its values. The second message from from {{reporter = admin}} which tells us that field does not exist (because the user cannot see it).

The behaviour of old JQL and change history should be consistent.
fields.summary: The "Change History" does not handle hidden/not shown fields in the same way as other JQL.

fields.description: With the fix for JRA-25034 to make specifying custom field values consistently allow the user seen value (in addition to the value id), the secondary value for a cascade select is not handled. It must still be specified as an id. The returned value when retrieving the data is now returned in the user seen value :).

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25731].
  {panel}

When the Linux installer is used, the jre shipped with JIRA is embedded in the bin/permgen.sh script, and that script then exports JAVA_HOME.

It would be good to document how to change the JAVA_HOME with JIRA 4.4, since all the ways it is documented for 4.3 and earlier may not work due to this script.
E.g. adding JAVA_HOME to the top of bin/setenv.sh didn't have any effect because of permgen.sh already doing an export.

One use case for this is when an admin has add certificates to a particular JVM's keystore and wishes to use that JVM and not the one shipped with the JIRA installer.
fields.summary: How to change JAVA_HOME with JIRA 4.4

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25729].
  {panel}

This bug report comes from a jira studio customer (https://jirastudio.kodak.com) which provided all the steps to reproduce in the support ticket as described below. 



Hi.
We ran across a odd ball error when one of our project administrators was trying to edit role members. This bug has been in the last couple of versions.

To Reproduce:
1) Create a project with all defaults. Make a copy of the Default permissions scheme and modify the permissions so that there are two roles in the Administer Projects permission (Using Administrators and EK_SQL_Low_Email, File: permprob1.jpg)
2) Assign the new permission scheme to the project.
3) Create two users "testuser1" and "testuser2", assign testuser1 to the Administrator, Developer and User roles and assign testuser2 to the EK_SQL_Low_Email, Developer and User roles. Neither of these users should be global administrators (i.e. not in the "administrators" group).
4) Login as testuser1, go to the people page and try to remove testuser2 from the EK_SQL_Low_Email role. You'll get a message "You can not remove a user/group that will result in completely removing yourself from this role." (File: permprob2.jpg)
5) As a workaround, if user testuser1 adds themself to the EK_SQL_Low_Email role, then they can remove testuser2 without error.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Error when a project admin is trying to remove a user from a role.

fields.summary: When a component is too long it is not fully viewable in the issue navigator

fields.description:
Basically the problem is the high number of projects and customfields. (for example 1135 projects and 362 customfields)

The first time this query runs it has to check which custom fields can be displayed. Because projects aren't limited this means it has to perform 1135 x 362 = 410870 checks if a custom field should be displayed. At the moment this means we run 410870 DB queries (you can see these if you turn on SQL debug logging). What's even worse is that some of the columns in the table we're querying don't have indexes so the db lookups take quite long. In other words these 400000+ queries can take hours to run!

These queries do get cached. After the cache is populated a search only takes 1 second to return the 297 results. The problem is though that this cache is cleared whenever the field configs change which I'm assuming on an instance with this many projects/fields is quite often. Given how long it takes to populate the cache it probably needs to be repopulated all the time.

For now there's isn't really a good solution other than to limit the number of projects and issue types when querying.

Adding DB indexes alone wont fix this since we're simply firing off too many queries. We need to figure out a way to reduce the number of queries!
fields.summary: Large number of projects and customfields causes performance degradation on the issue navigator
Role-based workflow

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25718].
  {panel}

Customers jira site is treated as local intranet site in our office environment, this cause IE9 and IE8 all use "IE7 standards" mode ( another colleague reported another bug when viewing a dropdown selection list on IE8, which is also caused by IE8 using IE7 standards more).

See:
http://sharovatov.wordpress.com/2009/05/18/ie8-rendering-modes-theory-and-practice/

"If there's no X-UA-Compatible value and site is in Local Intranet security zone, it will be rendered in EmulateIE7 mode by default."

The current workaround ( press F12, change it to IE9 standard for IE9 browser or IE8 standards for IE8 browser) only work for current IE instance, if I close all IE window and restart it again, I have to reset the browser mode for jira site again.

I think a new feature can be added to jira like:

if it found the client browser is IE8, send back header X-UA-Compatible to IE8;
if it found the client browser is IE9, send back header X-UA-Compatible to IE9.

IE7 mode in JIRA 4.4 has unpredictable behaviour as seen in the screenshot.
fields.summary: IE7 standards mode in IE8 and IE9 not to enable in JIRA

And so on.

fields.description:
See JRA-25034. This problem only occurs on 4.4.1, similar testing on 4.4.0 and other jira levels has not experienced this problem. 

The problem occurs running [JIRA CLI|https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/JCLI] automated tests which:
# Run a large number of SOAP and rest requests
# Includes issue creates and issue clones
#- Some base clone operations -JIRA Clone Plus Plugin see related- [https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/JCPP-36]
#- Problems still occur after fix applied for that issue
# Concurrent requests are made (and the problem seems to occur with higher levels of concurrency)

Numerous recreates have been attempted to narrow down the problem. Symptoms include:
# Freezes creating or cloning issues (UI or via remote request)
# Socket timeout on remote request
{noformat}
Remote error: ; nested exception is: 
    [error] 	java.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed out
{noformat}
# A project that cannot be deleted (completely) - delete says not found, create says already exists 
#- this might be a side affect of the freezes and subsequent stopping or canceling
# Restore from back freezes
# Logs contain numerous entries like
{noformat}
Existing issue found for key ZJIRACLI-29. Incrementing key.
{noformat}

Once the problem occurs, it is likely that jira needs to be restored from backup after deleting the DB. 

Attached a log after automation and UI create issue freezes. 

h3. Recreate
You will need a JCLI gint test environment similar to what Trevor did in https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-25034?focusedCommentId=264065&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-264065 - use the latest snapshots
# New 4.4.1 install
# On install screen, import https://bitbucket.org/bob_swift/jira-cli/downloads/jira-cli-test-jira-4.2.4-export.zip and specify license
# Run the test
#- *-DmaxParallel=8* is the default for concurrent actions, if this is set to 1, it seems to work
# Freeze and/or socket timeout
#- attached catalina.out after the test started freeze
fields.summary: JIRA freezes creating issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25707].
  {panel}

The sub-task should inherit the parent component/version even after parent issue has been moved to other project.   

Steps to reproduce:
# Create a issue in a Project A and assign a Fix Version of "Sprint 1".
# Create sub-task under this issue, fix version will automatically will be assigned to this sub-task i.e "Sprint 1".
# Move the issue to a another project say Project B.
# While moving the issue it will ask for the FixVersion for this issue of Project B.
# Select FixVersion "Sprint 1" in Project B(if fixversion is not there please create a fix version "Sprint 1" in Project B ).
# Afer moving the issue go to Project B and open the movied issue.
# Open its sub-task.
# The sub-task FixVersion is 'unassigned' now, in principle when the issue's fix version is moved its sub-task fix version must also be moved to new project.
fields.summary: When moving an issue with sub-tasks, the sub-tasks should inherit the parent component/version automatically
Role-based menu access

Images are only shown if users are accessing their email using a client (e.g. their web browser) that shares the same session that they have used to log into JIRA. In the case that they are not, no image is shown.

Steps to reproduce:

# Perform an activity that notifies {{user2}} via email (e.g. @mention).
# Ensure that you are not logged into JIRA and check {{user2}}'s email inbox.
# BUG: Custom image picked by {{user1}} is not shown in email notifications.

*Special note:* This has reoccured in later versions of JIRA and is being worked on in [JRA-41675|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41675].

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
*NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25703].
{panel}
{panel:title=Atlassian Update - 7 September 2017|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi all,

We're excited to announce that we've added support for 25 new programming languages in the code macro and it is now available in JIRA Software 7.5 starting from today!
We really appreciate your patience with this feature request.

Now the code macro supports the following languages:
 * Actionscript
 * Ada
 * Applescript
 * Bash
 * C
 * C#
 * C++
 * CSS (Less, Sass)
 * Erlang
 * Go
 * Groovy
 * Haskell
 * HTML
 * Java
 * Javascript
 * Lua
 * Objective-C
 * Perl
 * Php
 * Python
 * R
 * Nyan
 * Ruby
 * Scala
 * Sql (but like [lots more keywords|https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/atlassian-renderer/pull-requests/21/jsds-337-update-code-macro/diff#chg-src/main/java/com/atlassian/renderer/v2/macro/code/formatter/SqlFormatter.java])
 * Swift
 * Visual Basic
 * XML
 * Yaml

As we've mentioned before, our Cloud and Server deployment options are now on separate roadmaps ([read more here|https://www.atlassian.com/blog/announcements/prioritizing-roadmaps-cloud-server-data-center]), but this is a great example of a new feature shipped in cloud, that was popular and prioritized with server customers, that we have brought into server.

JIRA Software 7.5 is now available to [download|https://atlassian.com/software/jira/download] so you can start planning your upgrade straight away!

Cheers,
Jakub Lazinski
Product Manager, JIRA Server
{panel}
*Original Description*
 Currently, though Confluence supports python in its code macro, JIRA does not. Attempting to use \{code:pyting} results in:

Unable to find source-code formatter for language: python. Available languages are: javascript, sql, xhtml, actionscript, none, html, xml, java

Can you please bring this functionality into JIRA?
fields.summary: No python code formatter in JIRA

fields.description:
Zooming in and making the browser to its max size didn't work for me as a workaround. If not possible while embedded I propose getting it back to pop up instead. The way it is right now is almost unusable for me. The auto layout is horrible as well now, but that's a different issue I guess.

*Workaround*
# ensure your browser is not maximised,
# open the workflow designer,
# scroll down to the bottom of the page,
# resize the browser window (any direction) by clicking and dragging from a window edge (not by using any fullscreen/maximise buttons).
fields.summary: Workflow Designer Overall Design Area Too Small
Logged time in subtasks should automatically substract its parent time estimate

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25700].
  {panel}

I have spent a couple of hours converting many of my workflow transitions to common transitions and then reordered them in XML only to discover that the common workflow transitions ALWAYS appear below the regular workflow items despite the order in the XML. Very frustrating.

I can not use the opsbar-sequence solution provided in JRA-5789 because the common workflow items are not in the same order for every transition (it would work nicely if that was what I was looking for - although still a pain to implement). 
For the record the opsbar-sequence is stored in the common action XML data for common transitions.

JIRA really needs a better method of implementing this order before the use of common transitions becomes more popular.
fields.summary: The order of common workflow transitions and regular workflow transitions can not be intermingled by editing XML

fields.description:
Cryptic error message after importing components.

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Importing+Data+from+Bugzilla doesn't bear a lot of similarity to the actual import process... eg. there is no Maximum issues and failues option anywhere along the line.

Log file contains the following stack trace:


2011-09-14 11:45:22,632 ERROR - Unexpected failure occurred. Importer will stop immediately. Data maybe in an unstable state

	at java.util.Formatter.checkText(Formatter.java:2503)

fields.description:
When we install JIRA we are using symbolic links to point to the home and data locations.
We run an upgrade of JIRA to version 4.4.1.
Everything went smooth until we looked at the backup files created by the installation program.
These were empty (probably because symbolic links are not followed when zipping ...)
fields.summary: Upgrade procedure - Backup of JIRA installs dont follow symbolic links

fields.description:
# Try to restore [^external.xml] into JIRA 4.4.x from the setup screen.
# Notice that you get a page saying that you can't do the restore (which is correct as per JRA-25497). 
# (BUG) There is a nice error message saying that you need to check the upgrade guide. This link points to (http://docs.atlassian.com/jira/docs-044/Upgrading+JIRA).

This is the 4.4 upgrade guide and has absolutely no reference to the things you need to do for the crowd embedded upgrade (which is 4.3). If the upgrade fails due a crowd embedded problem then we should point at a page that indicates how the problem can be solved.

*NOTE*: there are many errors this upgrade task can encounter and they all do the same thing.
fields.summary: When getting an upgrade link during Crowd upgrade failures we get pointed at the latest upgrade guide which has no information on the problems.
Upgrade fisheye plugin to 3.4.5 to ship in JIRA 4.4.2

fields.description:
Using the workflow designer.
I left my workstation for a few hours while in the middle of updating a workflow. When I returned I completed some work on the workflow and pressed the "Save" button. I was prompted with a pop-up JIRA Login: "Username and Password Are Required". I filled this in (correctly, I might add...) and it rejected my credentials "Login incorrect, please try again."

The catalina.out displyed the following (I added line numbers for reference):
{code}
1   2011-09-14 00:12:35,897 http-8080-9 ERROR jsword 12x1555x1 1yogxnq 1.220.34.71 ///plugins/servlet/jwd/amf/ [service.spring.utils.AMFSpringMethodInvoker] null
2   2011-09-14 00:12:44,552 http-8080-9 ERROR jsword 12x1556x1 1yogxnq 1.220.34.71 ///plugins/servlet/jwd/amf/ [springframework.ldap.control.AbstractRequestControlDirContextProcessor] No matching response control found for paged results - looking for 'class javax.naming.ldap.PagedResultsResponseControl
3   2011-09-14 00:12:44,553 http-8080-9 ERROR jsword 12x1556x1 1yogxnq 1.220.34.71 ///plugins/servlet/jwd/amf/ [service.spring.utils.AMFSpringMethodInvoker] null
4   2011-09-14 00:13:56,861 http-8080-9 ERROR jsword 13x1557x1 1yogxnq 1.220.34.71 ///plugins/servlet/jwd/amf/ [service.spring.utils.AMFSpringMethodInvoker] null
5   2011-09-14 00:20:18,666 http-8080-9 ERROR jsword 20x1558x1 1yogxnq 1.220.34.71 ///plugins/servlet/jwd/amf/ [springframework.ldap.control.AbstractRequestControlDirContextProcessor] No matching response control found for paged results - looking for 'class javax.naming.ldap.PagedResultsResponseControl
6   2011-09-14 00:20:18,667 http-8080-9 ERROR jsword 20x1558x1 1yogxnq 1.220.34.71 ///plugins/servlet/jwd/amf/ [service.spring.utils.AMFSpringMethodInvoker] null
{code}


Esc clears the login box, but I have no way of saving my work.
Line 1 & 4 appear when the login prompt is displayed (in this case I pressed Esc between lines 3 & 4)
Lines 2,3,5,6 appear when I attempt to login.

In other browser windows I am able to access JIRA normally, open other Workflow Designer windows - even edit and save the other workflows using the workflow designer, but I still can not save the workflow I am working on.  :(

I had been able to save the workflow previously - I suspect it was the time that elapsed.
Under my user profile the "Last Failed Login: Not recorded"
fields.summary: Saving in Workflow Designer prompts for login - which always fails and generates error in logs
Add click-expanders for lists in scheme management pages

fields.description:
There has been a major database regression with >40% of database I/O now caused by repeated updating of the User/Issue history.

Refer to the screen shots from the performance profiles to see what and where.
fields.summary: Big database performance hit in JIRA 4.4.1
Javadocs out of sync with source code

fields.description:
When adding a _Two Dimensional Filter Statistics_ you can chose a field to be used in the _YAxis_ as well as one in the _XAxis_. If you select a *Custom Field* type *Multi Select* in _Yaxis_ then JIRA automatically adds two brackets '[' around the field value. The consequences? When you click on the value it won't return anything since searches for '[xxxx]' instead of 'xxxx'.

This behavior has been verified with JIRA 4.4. using a _Multi Select_ custom field. Perhaps the same occurs under another circumstances.

Check out bellow some illustrative screenshots:

!multiselect.png!
_A custom field multi select is configured. Its options have no brackets in the name._

!tdsf_config.png!
_Choosing this custom field as Yaxis value._

!error.png!
_Notice how the values are disposed._

!results.png!
_When you click on the value, there's no result._
fields.summary: Two Dimensional Filter Statistics Gadget doesn't work as expected with Multi Select custom field as Y axis

fields.description:
When a group name in Microsoft AD is changed in any way (Capitalization, fixing a spelling mistake, or just changing the group name) after a sync of the corresponding user directory in JIRA, there is one of 2 things that will happen.

1. if it is a capitalization change, the sync errors out with a error such as:
{noformat}
2011-09-13 10:39:08,022 QuartzWorker-1 ERROR ServiceRunner     [atlassian.crowd.directory.DbCachingDirectoryPoller] Error occurred while refreshing the cache for directory [ 10000 ].
com.atlassian.crowd.embedded.ofbiz.db.DataAccessException: org.ofbiz.core.entity.GenericEntityException: while inserting: [GenericEntity:Group][id,11184][groupName,TestJiraGROUP][updatedDate,2011-09-13 10:39:07.937][description,null][directoryId,10000][lowerDescription,null][active,1][local,0][type,GROUP][lowerGroupName,testjiragroup][createdDate,2011-09-13 10:39:07.937] (SQL Exception while executing the following:INSERT INTO jiraschema.cwd_group (ID, group_name, lower_group_name, active, local, created_date, updated_date, description, lower_description, group_type, directory_id) VALUES (?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?, ?) (Cannot insert duplicate key row in object 'jiraschema.cwd_group' with unique index 'uk_group_name_dir_id'. The duplicate key value is (testjiragroup, 10000).))
{noformat}

In order to resolve that, you have to manually edit the database to fix the capitalization of the group name.  Then the sync completes successfully.

2. Any other change in the group name results in a new group being created in JIRA and the old group still staying around.  Therefore, any membership updates to this group will only be applied to locations using the new group name, and not to the old group name.  If the old group name is not being used anywhere, the group is still kept around after subsequent syncs as well.  So, it appears as though there is no clean-up of groups that are no longer in AD and therefore, may run into issues in the future with duplicate group names.


I do have one suggestion to aid in resolving this issue.  You could base all group entries in the database by using the objectGUID or the objectSid to determine if JIRA is looking at the same group as a previous entry.

Also, it would be nice for a group clean-up to be done during the sync so that if a group is not used in JIRA anymore, and it is not in the user directory being synced, then it will be removed from JIRA so that the groups do not grow out of control.

We are in the process of upgrading to 4.3.4, and were thinking about using full AD sync to control users, but since we have found this issue, we are having to re-address this to determine if we will still move forward with the upgrade.  If this were to be resolved in at least a future release, then we can live with this for a little while since groups don't usually change that frequently.

Thanks.
fields.summary: User Directory Sync using Microsoft AD does not update groups correctly when changes are made to AD group
Ability to filter issues with trackbacks to a certain domain or all domains
Show icons as text

fields.description:
I decided to use in Confluence for authorization Jira Server.
But i can manage membership in groups only inside Confluence Admin Panel (and then only in Read-Write mode for Jira Server User Directory). When i change membership for user inside Jira Admin Panel - this changes have not affect on Confluence. So, i have one way for administration of membership in groups with using Jira Server for authorization in Confluence and two point for administration function. When i trying using for authorization Crowd Version: 2.3.2 (Build:#524 - 10-08-2011) all was normally - Confluence took any changes of membership in groups.
fields.summary: Only one way for administration of membership in groups with using Jira Server for authorization in Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-25678].
  {panel}

It appears the z-index on the JIRA Header is exposing the following issue with Safari on Mac OS X.
http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5305680/mac-safari-5-0-4-bug-when-using-google-maps-api/5486463#5486463

Whenever the Google Map is displayed, the header just disappears. See screenshot, or view this live issue http://connect.onjira.com/browse/NERDS-412 (Click on the location field)

This does not happen in Studio, or in JIRA 4.3.
fields.summary: JIRA Header disappears when a Google Map is rendered in JIRA
